title: Vice President Biden to Travel to Orlando, Florida | whitehouse.gov
content:
The White House




August 17, 2009

 



Vice President Biden to Travel to Orlando, Florida




 THE WHITE HOUSE Office of the Vice President  ___________________________________________________________________________  For Immediate Release                                                       August 17, 2009 **MEDIA ADVISORY**  Vice President Biden to Travel to Orlando, Florida   Washington, D.C. – On Wednesday, August 19, Vice President Biden will travel to Jackson Middle School in Orlando, FL, where he will deliver remarks highlighting the Recovery Act to local educators, parents, and students. Vice President Biden will be joined by Education Secretary Arne Duncan. This event is OPEN PRESS. Additional media details are below. Media Details: Vice President Biden to travel to Orlando, Florida Event Speakers:            Vice President Joe Biden                                     Education Secretary Arne Duncan Date:                             August 19, 2009 Location:                        Jackson Middle School, Media Center                                    6000 Stonewall Jackson Road, Orlando, FL Press Entrance:               Side entrance off parking lot, directed on site Sat Truck Parking:          Side parking lot to the left of the main entrance of the school, directed on site General Parking:            Side parking lot to the left of the main entrance of the school Camera Preset:                7:00-7:30 AM EDT Restricted Access:            7:30-8:30 AM EDT Press Arrival:                    8:30 AM EDT Final Press Access:            9:30 AM EDT Event Begins:                  10:00 AM EDT Cable Run:                      400 ft Throw:                               35 ft RSVP: This event is OPEN PRESS. Media must RSVP with the NAME, POSITION (Reporter, TV Camera, Photog, etc.) MEDIA OUTLET, PHONE AND EMAIL for each person planning to cover the event to press@ovp.eop.gov by Tuesday, August 18, at 5:00 PM EDT. At the event, you will be required to wear your outlet’s media credential at all times, either around the neck or pinned to clothing. Ground Contact: For press logistics questions, please call Hollis Chappell at 202-757-7558
